author: Gus_263
title: Hordika vakama
review: Not the original, he likes very much to the hordika. It can be a problem, but it is good to have combinations, like of he and whenua, one of the best combinations. The claws looks very a fire weapon, and the mask, very a beast. The right arm have gear system, and the body was maked to launch spinner set. Good.

author: Carl
title: Looks like a lion (sort of)
review:
I wasn't that fussed on Toa Metru Vakama, but Hordiak Vakama is awesome. The faces of all Hordika are great for Rahi MOCs, and the Rhotuka spinner is one of the best projectile weapons Bionicle designers have made.

Pros:
Hordika chest-plate
Rhotuka spinner
Nice colours
Hordika feet
Cool weapons
Mask looks sort of like a lion
Hordika limbs
Swivelling arm mechanism
Nice build

Cons:
Rhotuka spinners are easily lost

But if you can use the Rhotuka spinner properly (DAD!) then the Rhotuka spinners can't get lost. All the Hordika are cool except Nokama, so they are a must have Bionicle subtheme.

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO BIONICLE (Toa Hordika) - Toa Hordika Vakama Review
review:
This is a great figure to have and it's fun to play with as well.

Box/Instructions

The instruction has 29 pages and there're no mistakes in it.

Parts

This set has 48 pieces and it was 9 USD when it was on sale. That means that the price per piece ratio was 19 cents per piece which is a good value for a figure like this.

The build

The build is very nice and easy and we also don't need to worry about stickers.

The completed model

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/8736-1.jpg[/img]


The arms, the hands, the legs, the feet and the head can be adjusted. On both hands we can see a torch and on one arm we can also see a gear which you can use to move that arm up and/or down. On the back of the torso is a spinner which flies very well, too.

Summary

All in all this set is an great set and I would HIGHLY recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full gallery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de


Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion

Review

author: tkettle9719
title: The Fire Zombie!
review:
I got this set from my parents for my birthday in 2005, and think that this is the best of the zombied Hordika. It looks quite amazing, and is just awesome because of the fire element.

Pros

  • -The fire swords are the single best thing in this set except for the
  • -Epic Rhotuka spinner, which works fascinatingly well for its size, very aerodynamic design.
  • …

Cons

  • -I like the mask, but it's just horrible since it's attached the way it is without a mask holder.
  • -I also find the overall build of every Hordika very similar, boring.
  • …

This set is truly an amazing one, and will be hunted down by fans everywhere. I highly recommend this, but don't buy all of the Hordika.

author: Tinyxcan123
title: Great starter BIONICLE!
review:
Review of set 8736-1.

Box:
The packaging is big enough to fit Vakama in, although it does crack when it's under a lot of weight (Because it's plastic).

Instructions:
The instructions are readable and the paper isn't too delicate either.

Toa Vakama:
The overall figure is very good and stays together well. The disk can fly off Vakama. His weapons are good-looking and suit the figure, but why is there things that protect the fire?

Overall, this is a great set and it's worth £6/9$. If you find a cheap one online, I really recommend that you should buy it.
